availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert G. Botts (Daviess County, Kentucky, attorney, judge, and politician)

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, attorney, judge, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Botts. Father of Nancy Botts, Charles A. Botts, Thomas B. Botts, Emma Botts, and Adda Botts. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Nelson County, Kentucky, from 1845 to 1846. Judge of the Daviess County Court from 1858 to 1866. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Attorney in Daviess County in 1860.

bibl.p:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 119; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Daviess County, District 2, p. 12; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, Ky.: Collins & Co., 1882), 153 and 645; Kentucky Wills and Probate Records, 1812-1936, Kentucky County Court, vol. A-D,
p. 336-37 (accessed via ancestry.com).
